title.narrative: STATE INSTITUTIONS - MANAGEMENT AND INTERSECTORIAL

description.narrative: State institutions have management and intersectoral coordination capacities to increase coverage and improve the quality of services that favor the survival and full development of children under 6 years of age, especially those in situations of exclusion., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development (Covid), Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children under 6 years of age in situations of exclusion will reach full development in their family and community environments, with inclusive and equitable access to social programmes and services, even in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: State institutions have management and intersectoral coordination capacities to increase coverage and improve the quality of services that favor the survival and full development of children under 6 years of age, especially those in situations of exclusion.

description.narrative: The MoH and MoFAC, with UNICEF support, have increased the number of children under six years of age who have received comprehensive care for their development from 13,098 (2018) to 14,851 (2019) using the institutional modality; and from 40,000 (2018) to 50,000 (2019) with the house-to-house visit modality. The number of mothers, fathers and / or guardians with sons and daughters under 6 years of age trained in parenting with tenderness, positive discipline and stimulation, taking advantage of families' daily life routines increased from 3,750 (2018) to 6,072 (2019). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of front line workers trained on ECD
Percentage of districts implementing at least 3 interventions to improve the quality of maternal and newborn care at primary health care level
Number of parents/caregivers of children under 5 receiving parenting support to improve care and development of their children with support of UNICEF in the reporting year [COVID]
Number of mothers, fathers and caregivers who receive training on parental skills
ECD is integrated in UNICEF's emergency preparedness and response plan and implementation

actual.value: 2020:In 2019, UNICEF has progressed on preparing the conditions for integrating emergency preparedness in ECD programme component. Workshops have been conducted to train frontline workers on this issue.

title.narrative: Country Programme incorporates early stimulation, protection and nutrition packages targeting children aged 0-3 (Including Care for Child Development)

actual.value: 2020:In 2019, UNICEF prepared the conditions for incorporating CCD in programming. A first workshop has been conducted to train frontline workers on this issue.

title.narrative: Existence of a national management information system that includes disaggregated data on nutrition, including sex-disaggregated data
Integration of nutrition counselling in pregnancy care programmes

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF will be supporting to MoH including counselling' data in the Perinatal Informatic Sytem + for improve the report.

title.narrative: Number of children benefiting from early childhood education trough alternative approches such as home base provision of ECD
